titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller Foundation records, Field Offices, Ankara, Turkey, RG 6, SG 19
A Guide to the Rockefeller Foundation records, Field Offices, Ankara, Turkey, RG 6, SG 19 FA399

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-08-17 00:38:27 -0400.

did.unittitle: Rockefeller Foundation records, field offices, Ankara, Turkey, RG 6, SG 19

physdesc.extent: 6 legal document boxes, 10 letter document boxes.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

otherfindaid.p: Other available finding aids describing Rockefeller Foundation records, Field Offices include:

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Mideast Wheat Research and Training Project records contain general correspondence and administrative documents pertaining to the Turkish wheat stations and the various foundations and institutions connected to wheat research in Turkey during the 1970s. Correspondence, reports, and printed material detail the Center's wheat research work and plant breeding and its interactions with Turkish authorities and with other agricultural institutes and university agronomists. This collection documents the day-to-day work of the Center; for materials regarding the establishment and administration of the Wheat Research Center one should consult the files on Turkish Wheat Research in the Rockefeller Foundation project files, RG 1, Accession 83, Series 105 (804).

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: The Mideast Wheat Research and Training program was a project funded by the Rockefeller Foundation to help with crop research and agricultural production in Turkey. The program included breeding of adapted varieties of both spring and winter wheat for various ecological conditions, training for wheat scientists from cooperating countries, and advice and assistance in the development of the local research and production programs. In September 1967 the Rockefeller and Turkey began negotiations for the Rockefeller Foundation to participate in the development of the national wheat program. By July 1, 1970, the Turkish Wheat Research and Training Center had been established. The Rockefeller Foundation agreed to a start-up grant of $100,000, which was to expire at the end of 1968. Rockefeller Foundation funding was extended and renewed through the 1970s. In 1977 the Rockefeller Foundation signed a final three-year extension.
Quality was not considered important at the start of the project. Rather, the point was to produce a large amount of wheat. The project pioneered an approach to the problem of a specific crop.

There were several issues with the Wheat Research Project that quickly became apparent. Initially, only fluent English speakers were eligible for overseas training. As the program developed, staff received English language instruction before going for training, but once abroad they required additional training in order to function effectively and produce. Relations with the Turkish government were also complicated, and issues arose with organization and method. There were also struggles with various governmental departments. These issues were not helped by Turkey's bureaucracy and climate of administrative instability, attributable to constantly changing governments.
Over thirteen years Turkish wheat production increased from around 10 million metric tons to 17 million with general agreement that this increase was largely owing to the wheat improvement project.

Various names were used to refer to the Wheat Research and Training Program, including: Middle East Wheat Improvement Project, Wheat Improvement Project, Wheat Research Program, Mid-East Wheat Research and Training Center, and Ankara Field Office.
Significant staff members include: Ahmet Demirlicakmak, Charles K. Mann, E. E. Saari, Jon Michael Prescott, and Bill C. Wright.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: RAC users must abide by all applicable provisions of United States copyright law. Reproduction/duplication of archival items is routinely provided in accordance with "fair use." If the RAC does not hold copyright for an archival collection, or items within a collection, it is the user's responsibility to contact the copyright holder, or make a fair effort to do so, prior to publication.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Records more than 20 years old are open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: Administrative and other files relating to the Ankara Field Office, Mid-East Wheat Research and Training Center, are found in the Rockefeller Foundation project files, RG 1, Accession 83, Series 105 (804), under Turkish Wheat Research.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Deryn Cro processed the Ankara Field Office series in July 2011. Processing Level 3: Standard Processing. All material is available in acid-free manuscript boxes and folders.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Files are arranged in two series:

arrangement.head: Series arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged alphabetically, following the report file on Wheat Research in Turkey.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "The Cooperative Wheat Research Program in Turkey: A Report to the Ministry of Agriculture and to the Rockefeller Foundation." Report prepared by Ralph W. Cummings, H.A. Rodenhiser, J.W. Gibler.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Demirlicakmak was Director of the Wheat Research and Training Center.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: File includes reports by Arthur Klatt and Bill C. Wright on work underway in Turkey.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Finfrock was an Experiment Station Development Officer.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: In 1974, Mann was an Economist with the Rockefeller Foundation's Social Sciences Field Staff, assigned to the Middle East Wheat Project. From 1971-1974, he had been with the U.S. Agency for International Development in Ankara.

arrangement.head: Series arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged alphabetically, with general correspondence files placed at the start.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials relate to a Rockefeller Foundation grant to the Development Foundation of Turkey (GA SS 7615), for "Description and Analysis of Wheat Farming in Turkey with Implications for Agricultural Policy." Resat Aktan was the principal investigator for the project.

did.unittitle: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Preliminary draft chapter on "Recent Forced-Pace Campaigns." Includes review of wheat program in Turkey.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Most of the correspondence concerns the Arid Lands Agricultural Development Program.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials consist mainly of correspondence and reports relating to the Ford Foundation's Arid Lands Agricultural Development Program.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "Present Livestock Situation in the Near East and the Possibility of Developing Integrated Crop-Livestock Farming Systems." Arid Lands Agricultural Development Program, Ford Foundation, Beirut, Lebanon, 1973 March.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "Progress Report of the Near East Cooperative Sorghum and Millets Crop Improvement Program." Arid Lands Agricultural Development Program, Ford Foundation, Beirut, Lebanon, 1973 April (Progress Report 1972).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "Summary Report on the Regional Sheep and Forage Production Workshop,February 11-14, 1974, Lebanon." Arid Lands Agricultural Development Program, Ford Foundation, Beirut, Lebanon, 1974 October.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The correspondence for 1975 is primarily outgoing.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes copy of "Accelerated Cereals Production Project Seeding Report," 1970-1971, Tunisia, Ministry of Agriculture.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Progress Report: Tunisia, 1973-1974. Prepared by CIMMYT in cooperation with the Technical Division of the Office of Cereals.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Gallun worked with the United States Department of Agriculture's Agricultural Research Service at Purdue University. He was an Investigations Leader in the Entomology Research Division.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The India files contain correspondence with officers in the Rockefeller Foundation field office in New Delhi and more general correspondence with Indian researchers and academics.

did.unittitle: International Center for Agricultural Research in the Dry Areas (ICARDA)
International Crops Research Institute for the Semi-Arid Tropics (ICRISAT)
International Maize and Wheat Improvement Center (CIMMYT)

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Files are often separated into incoming and outgoing correspondence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "What is CIMMYT?" paper consisting of fourteen charts designed to introduce the organization to visitors.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Loegering was Professor of Plant Pathology at the University of Missouri.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Rupert was a research associate with the Agronomy Department of the University of California, Davis, and with the International Maize and Wheat Improvement Center. He had previously served as an associate director with the Rockefeller Foundation's agriculture program in Chile.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Saari was a Plant Pathology expert with the Ford Foundation in India and then in Lebanon (from mid-1973).

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Ron Stubbs was affiliated with the Institute of Phytopathological Research in the Netherlands.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Incoming and outgoing correspondence may be separated within the files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "Country and Inter-Country Programming: Turkey." UNDP assistance requested by the Government of Turkey for the period 1973-1977. Official Draft, January 1973.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Incoming and outgoing correspondence is generally separated within the files.

scopecontent.p: Report of Survey and Recommendations on Agricultural Research in Afghanistan, by Agricultural Research Review Team, 1972 October 25.

did.unittitle: United States Agency for International Development: Morocco

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Winkelmann was an economist for the International Maize and Wheat Improvement Center.
